transcripts.prompt: Please transcribe the text from the following image with high accuracy. Ensure that all punctuation, capitalization, and formatting are preserved as closely as possible to the original. If any part of the text is illegible or unclear, indicate this with '[illegible]' in the transcription. Pay special attention to names, dates, and any specific terminology. Please provide only the transcription.
transcripts.original_text: 28 Billingham Street Somerville, Mass. May 22, 1935 Re: Identity of Daniel Howe (How) of Tyringham, Massachusetts, Revolutionary War Soldier. Bureau of Pensions, Gentlemen: It is desired to learn the name or names of one or both of the parents of this Daniel Howe of Tyringham, Mass. Did this Daniel Howe or his wife receive a pension. His service record as give in "Massachusetts Soldiers and Sailors in the War of the Revolution," Vol. VIII, p. 329, is as follows: "How. Daniel, Tyringham (also given Arundel), Order on Maj. Barber, payable to Lieut. John Chadwick: also, Private, Joseph Strebben's Co., Col. Jonathan Brewer's regt; muster Roll Aug.1 1775 enlisted May 12 1775; service, 81 days; also, Company return (probably Oct., 1775); also, order of bounty cost or its equivalent in money dated Prospect Hill, Oct. 26 1775; also, return of men raised for Continental service probably from Capt. Harick's (Herrick's) co; residence, Tyringham; engaged for town of Tyringham; joined Capt. Chadwick's co., Col. Brewer's regt.; term, 3 years; also, list of men mustered between Jan. 20 1777 and June 1, 1778 by Trueman Wheeler, Muster Master for Berkshire Co.; Capt. Stone's co.; also Sergeant, Capt. Mean's co.; Col. Ebeneser Sprout's regt.; Continental Army pay accounts for service from Jan. 1, 1777, to Sept. 14, 1779; reported discharged Sept. 14 1779; also, Capt. John Chadwick's co., Col. Brewer's regt.; returns dated Jan. 22 1778; residence, Arundel; enlisted for town of Tyringham, mustered by Muster Master Wheeler; reported sick at Tyringham." It is surmised, but no proof has been found, that this Daniel Howe was the son of Daniel and Ann (Bronson) Howe, born 4 Oct. 1741 at Waterbury, Conn. and that his wife's name was Damaris (Dutton) Howe. Does his pension or other record give any of these data. Respectfully [signature of J. Albert Holmes] J. Albert Holmes

Bureau of Pensions, Washington, D. C.  Gentlemen:            It is desired to learn the name or names of one or both of the  parents of this Daniel Howe of Tyringham, Mass.            Did this Daniel Howe or his wife receive a pension.            His service record as given in “Massachusetts Soldiers and Sailors  in the War of the Revolution" Vol. VIII, p. 329, is as follows:            “How, Daniel, Tyringham (also given Arundel). Order on Maj. Barber,  payable to Lieut. John Chadwick; also, Private, Joseph Stedbee's co., Col.  Jonathan Brewer’s regt; muster roll Aug. 1, 1775 enlisted May 12 1775; service, 81 days; also, Company return (probably Oct., 1775); also, order of bounty  coat or its equivalent in money dated Prospect Hill, Oct. 26 1775; also,  return of men raised for Continental service probably from Capt. Harkick’s  (Herrick’s) co.; residence, Tyringham; engaged for town of Tyringham; joined  Capt. Chadwick’s co., Col. Brewer’s regt; term, 3 years; also, list of men  mustered between Jan. 20 1777 and June 1, 1778 by Trueman Wheeler, Muster  Master for Berkshire Co.; Capt. Stone’s co.; also Sergeant, Capt. Dean’s co.,  Col. Ebenezer Sprout’s regt.; Continental Army pay accounts for service  from Jan. 1, 1777, to Sept. 14, 1779; reported discharged Sept. 14, 1779;  also, Capt. John Chadwick’s co., Col. Brewer’s regt.; returns dated Jan. 22,  1778; residence, Arundel; enlisted for town of Tyringham; mustered by Muster  Master Wheeler; reported sick at Tyringham.”            It is surmised, but no proof has been found, that this Daniel Howe was the son of Daniel and Ann (Bronson) Howe, born 4 Oct. 1741 at Waterbury,  Conn. and that his wife’s name was Damaris (Dutton) Howe.            Does his pension or other record give any of these data.                                     Respectfully                                    (Signature)                                     J. Albert Holmes.
